Title: Product Owner
RoleDescription: Job description A Product Owner is the proxy for the customer to one or more Software Engineering teams. Through ownership of the Product Backlog (scope and prioritization) and care for the whole of the product(s), (features, non-functional behaviour, quality, and technical debt), they are responsible for maximizing the value of the product(s) through software engineering work. Building effective relationships with management and stakeholders, in different countries, timezones and cultures, is key to success in this role, as is a high degree of technical expertise to comprehend the complex nature of our products.  Requirement Gathering and Analysis  responsible for:   Learning the product, to ensure proper understanding of context, features and functions   Producing clear, high-quality, specific, and unambiguous, functional and nonfunctional requirements for changes of various complexities   Providing a high-quality detailed analysis with the customer journey in mind, working through requirements in an agile manner, considering for fitness of purpose, adherence to business objectives, and consistency, challenging positively where appropriate.   Defining specific and measurable Acceptance Criteria   The acceptance of those requirements by Software Engineering teams for execution   Collecting feedback and defining requirements from all the involved stakeholders via scheduled and non-scheduled mechanisms   Reviewing and confirming that designed features/functions ultimately meet the specified intent, requirements, business and end-user needs where applicable.   Assessing reported defects, non-functional requirements, and other technical debt, triaging severity and prioritizing resolution alongside feature work, to ensure not only that the product always meets established Quality Criteria, but that quality continuously improves.   Generating documents and other artifacts describing current and future product features and functions, using approved processesPrioritization and Planning  responsible for:   Setting priorities in collaboration with key stakeholders against planned objectives, and supporting sprint planning and other preparatory activities, ensuring that the product needs and vision are maintained.   Tracking progression over time to ensure client, business, and technical goals are met   Coordinating development and defect resolution across multiple teams, programmes and locations, and identifying dependencies between teams   Continuously seeking ways to improve processes to increase efficiency and performance.Working Practices and Relationships:The individual would work with different sets of stakeholders, both technical and business, from Software Engineering Teams to Project/Programme Management, Product Management and Delivery to assist with strategic planning and gain early knowledge of future scope and goals. They would regularly:   Engage with Software Engineering teams and related stakeholders as part of an Agile team, ensuring that Software Engineers understand requirements.   Work with Software Engineering teams to discover underlying design gaps and/or technical gaps against associated risks e.g. security, performance, usability, etc.   Maintain a clear view on progress and articulating it to stakeholders, alongside issues and risks   Confidently facilitate meetings, present and demonstrate software at different levels.   Advocate for Agile practices to achieve increasingly Agile working.
